data.title: Hollywood Bowl
data.meta_description: All of the info you need to plan for your visit to the Hollywood Bowl including how to print tickets, buy gift certificates and more.
data.text:
Please arrive at the theatre with enough time to take your seats before the scheduled performance. Gates will open 2 hours before the start of a concert and we suggest arriving at least 90 minutes prior to your performance.

Visit our Getting Here page for directions, parking, public transportation and ride share, Park & Ride and Bowl Shuttle information and more.

Permalink

You’re welcome to bring your own food and non-alcoholic drinks* to the Hollywood Bowl.

Bringing wine and beer is dependent on the type of event you’re attending.

For LA Phil-presented events, feel free to bring wine bottles, wine glasses and beer bottles inside.

For Lease Events, alcohol isn’t permitted.

Not sure if your event is an LA Phil-presented event?

A full list of LA Phil-presented events may be found here. Wine and beer are welcome at these events

A full list of Lease Events may be found here. Outside alcohol is not permitted.

Container size matters. All containers, picnic baskets and coolers must be able to fit under your seats or within your box. Containers, picnic baskets and coolers measuring more than 15 inches wide, 15 inches high or 22 inches long won’t be allowed past the tickets gate.

*For lease events, non-alcoholic beverages must be in Factory-sealed plastic bottles that are one liter or less.

Permalink

Gates will open two hours prior to the start of a concert and Please arrive at the theatre with enough time to take your seats before the scheduled performance. We suggest arriving at least 90 minutes prior to your performance.

Visit our Getting Here page for directions, parking, public transportation and ride share, Park & Ride / Bowl Shuttle information and more.

Permalink

Exterior park areas including parking lots are open 8am to 6pm on most days. Whether or not the theatre is open to the public varies depending on the events in the theatre that day.

The Hollywood Bowl is owned and operated by Los Angeles County Department of Parks and Recreation, and is jointly managed with the Los Angeles Philharmonic Association.

Permalink

Rehearsals are typically for classical concerts on Tuesdays and Thursdays during the Bowl season. These are working rehearsal for staff, crew and performers are subject to change without notice. Rehearsal schedules for the week and whether a rehearsal will be open to the public is typically unknown until the Monday of the week.

You may contact Audience Services to receive up to date information regarding upcoming performance schedules by calling 323 850 2000 and choosing to listen to a pre-recorded listing of upcoming rehearsals open to the public or emailing information@laphil.org.

No advanced reservation is required to attend. Rehearsals open to the public have limited seating in specific sections. Rehearsal staff will be on hand to advise where you may sit. No telephoto lenses are tripods are allowed in.

Permalink

By law (LACC 17.04.645), smoking is not permitted on the Hollywood Bowl grounds, except in designated areas. Violators are subject to removal. Smoking outside the smoking areas is considered a misdemeanor and could lead to arrest. This policy includes electronic cigarettes and vaporizers. A map of the designated smoking areas may be found here.

Permalink

Please arrive at the theatre with enough time to take your seats before the scheduled performance. Gates will open 2 hours before the start of a concert and we suggest arriving at least 90 minutes prior to your performance.

Visit our Getting Here page for directions, parking, public transportation and ride share, Park & Ride and Bowl Shuttle information and more.

Permalink

Rideshare drop-off and pick-up at the Bowl are located in Lot C (Purple). Direct your rideshare to our location at 6655 Odin St., Los Angeles for pick-up and drop-off. View a map of the rideshare pick-up and drop-off location at the bottom of our Getting Here page.

To avoid longer pickup wait times and surge pricing, rideshare patrons are also encouraged to consider using the Bowl Shuttle system. Instead of planning your rideshare route to the Bowl itself, consider using one of the Shuttle lots (Ventura Blvd in Studio City or Ovation/Hollywood & Highland). You can purchase a shuttle ticket to complete the rest of the route to the Bowl, and then ride the shuttle back to those locations after the concert.

Permalink

Park & Ride: These are lots located in different neighborhoods and cities throughout Los Angeles County and these buses depart at scheduled departure times. When purchasing your ticket, you may select your desired departure time. Visit our Park & Ride page for ticket information.

Shuttles: Drive to one of the close-to-the-Bowl shuttle lots and hop onto the continuously departing shuttles. Bowl shuttles continually depart every 15-20 minutes beginning 2 1/2 hours before the concert. The last bus departs each lot at concert time. Visit our Bowl Shuttle page for ticket information.

Permalink

Park & Ride: Advanced sales for Park & Ride end 10am the day before the concert. You may still purchase a ticket onsite at the lot. They're $12 cash per person for LA Phil presented events and $15 cash per person for Lease Events, pending availability.

Please note that we encourage exact change as employees do not carry change. If you choose to purchase Park & Ride onsite the day of the concert, we encourage you to arrive early as priority boarding will be given to advanced ticket holders.

Bowl Shuttle: You may purchase tickets to our Bowl Shuttle service online up until one hour before the start of the show. Tickets are $6 (cash or card) per person for LA Phil presented events and $12 cash per person for Lease Events.

Permalink

Go to our Park and Ride & Bowl Shuttle Locations page for a full list of our 2024 season location options.

Departure times for Park & Ride lots vary from concert to concert. Available departure times will be visible when purchasing Park & Ride tickets.

Please note: lot locations, departure times, and availability are subject to change and may not be available for all concerts. Check your concert's page for available locations.

Permalink

The Hollywood Bowl Museum is a celebration of one of Los Angeles' most historic landmarks--a venue that has played a major role in music and entertainment, and has helped shape the careers of some of the most famous performers of the 20th and 21st centuries.

Located at the bottom of Peppertree Lane, the Hollywood Bowl Museum is the first building visitors see upon entering the grounds from Highland Avenue.

Admission is free.

Summer Hours

(June–September, exact dates variable by season)

Monday: 4 hours prior to show time

Tuesday–Saturday: 10AM - show time

Sunday: 4 hours prior to show time

Off-Season Hours

(Mid–September through June, exact dates variable by season)

Tuesday–Friday: 10AM - 5PM

Saturday–Monday: closed

Closed: Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day

Permalink

Although there's no minimum age for admittance, many evening concerts aren't suitable for young children. Children ages 2 and up must have a ticket to enter the theater, must sit in the seat indicated on the ticket, and should be able to sit quietly through a concert. Children under 2 years of age do not need a ticket.

Permalink

You may pre-order a picnic box to to pick up or Supper in Your Box Seats delivered directly to your box online. Orders for both options below must be placed before 6pm the day before your concert.

You may pre-order your picnic box or Supper in Your Box Seats here.

Simply select the date you wish to purchase, your options, and checkout!

Permalink

Generally, we do not have set times until the artist goes on stage. Therefore, we are unable to provide set times in advance. To ensure that you don’t miss any of your concert, we encourage all patrons to arrive early.

Permalink

Surrounding the Hollywood Bowl are 14 beautiful picnic areas, some of which open as early as four hours before your concert. Picnicking at the Bowl provides you with the opportunity to enjoy the

Picnic tables are available on a first-come, first-served basis, and one person/group is allowed to reserve each table. Large groups (30+) may reserve selected picnic areas through the Group Services Office by calling 323 850 2050. Tailgating in the parking lots is not permitted.stunning views and unwind with friends.

You may view of a map of the picnic areas at the Hollywood Bowl on our picnic map.
